text: I had a very wise person tell me that he thinks marriage, when you're younger, you keep thinking you can fix things. That's what people do. And you can't really fix anything. It shouldn't be a massive difficult thing every day. Life's difficult enough.
author: Albert Brooks

text: Same-sex marriage would eliminate entirely in law the basic idea of a mother and a father for every child. It would create a society which deliberately chooses to deprive a child of either a mother or a father.
author: Keith O'Brien

text: Marriage is too interesting an experiment to be tried only once.
author: Eva Gabor

text: I've often thought if I didn't make my marriage work, I would have failed at my one true shot at happiness.
author: Bethenny Frankel

text: You have to work for everything. Marriage should not be any different.
author: Bethenny Frankel
